ossj.common
Class EventImpl

java.lang.Object
  ossj.common.AttributeAccessImpl
      ossj.common.EventImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, javax.oss.AttributeAccess, javax.oss.Event
Direct Known Subclasses:
AlarmEventImpl, ManagedEntityCreateEvent
public class EventImpl
extends AttributeAccessImpl
implements javax.oss.Event

An implementation class for the javax.oss.Event interface.

September 2005
Version:
1.2.2
Author:
OSS through Java(tm) Initiative

Method Detail

addAttributesTo

protected void addAttributesTo(AttributeManager anAttributeManager)
Description copied from class: AttributeAccessImpl
in this method, subclasses have to
  • call super.addAddtributesTo(attributeManager)
  • call attributeManager.addAttributes( ... ); with whatever attributes they want to add

Overrides:
addAttributesTo in class AttributeAccessImpl

configureAttributes

protected void configureAttributes(AttributeManager anAttributeManager)
Description copied from class: AttributeAccessImpl
in this method, subclasses can the type of the attributes, the added to the attribute manager in addAttributesTo(am). they can define them either as settable by calling attributeManager.setSettableAttributes( ... ) or optional attributes can be defined supported by calling attributeManager.setSupportedOptionalAttributes( ... )

Overrides:
configureAttributes in class AttributeAccessImpl

setApplicationDN

public void setApplicationDN(java.lang.String value)
                      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
The DN of the Application sending the Event. The format of this DN is:

deployment dependent top context /System=vendor-id /ApplicationType=api-name

under which the components the building block sending the event are deployed.

Specified by:
setApplicationDN in interface javax.oss.Event
Parameters:
value - Destinguished Name of the Application Type
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if format is not correct

getApplicationDN

public java.lang.String getApplicationDN()
The DN of the Application sending the Event. The format of this DN is:

deployment dependent top context /System=vendor-id /ApplicationType=api-name

under which the components the building block sending the event are deployed.

Specified by:
getApplicationDN in interface javax.oss.Event
Returns:
a string representation of the ApplicationDN

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object value)
Checks whether two Event are equal. The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is an Event object that has the arguments.

Overrides:
equals in class java.lang.Object
Parameters:
value - the Object to compare with this Event
Returns:
if the objects are equal; false otherwise.
